actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-214, by Mr. Wheat.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 48.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 3072. Points of order for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 2(l)(6) of rule XI; clause 7 of rule XXI; and clause 2 of rule XXI are waived. In any case where this resolution waives points of order against only a portion of a paragraph, a point of order against any other provision in such paragraph may be made against such provision and not against the entire paragraph. Measure will be read by section. Bill is open to amendments. It shall be in order to consider the amendment, if offered by Mr. Fazio or his designee, and all points of order against said amendment for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 2 of rule XXI are waived. It shall be in order to consider the amendment printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution if offered by Mr. Skaggs or his designee and all points of order against said amendme...
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order against consideration of the bill (H.R. 3072) making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1990, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Waives points of order against the consideration of H.R. 3072 (armed forces appropriations).

titles.title: Waiving certain points of order against consideration of the bill (H.R. 3072) making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1990, and for other purposes.
